definition: to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: What do you think of High school students' purchasing stock?
sentences.chinese: 你如何看待高中生學炒股票？

sentences.english: So she continued to choose fry this organized source of income.
sentences.chinese: 所以她繼續選擇炒股這條理財路。

sentences.english: He lost his fortune gambling on the stock exchange.
sentences.chinese: 他因炒股票損失了他的財產。

sentences.english: Some people become rich by winning the lottery or playing the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 有些人有錢是因爲中了彩票或者炒股票賺了一筆。

sentences.english: He had hurried to speculate on stocks, but had made no money.
sentences.chinese: 他急急地炒股票，一點錢也沒賺得。

sentences.english: He wants to make quick money so he trades stocks in speculation.
sentences.chinese: 他想盡快賺錢，所以他去炒股票。

sentences.english: Why, it cost hundreds, even thousands of dollars, to get into the game.
sentences.chinese: 因爲要想炒股，至少需要幾百甚至幾千美元。

sentences.english: Accordingly he is not fried besides oneself, deprecatory also employee is fried.
sentences.chinese: 因此他除了自己不炒股，也不贊成員工炒股。

sentences.english: Accordingly he is not fried besides oneself, deprecatory also employee is fried.
sentences.chinese: 因此他除了自己不炒股，也不贊成員工炒股。

sentences.english: So far I haven't heard any economist dare to invest stocks.
sentences.chinese: 迄今，沒聽說過哪個經濟學家敢炒股票。

sentences.english: Tangmou and others will be money for new stock and decoration, wantonly squandered.
sentences.chinese: 唐某等人將贓款用於炒股和裝修新房，大肆揮霍。

sentences.english: He's speculating in stocks and lost a lot of money.
He earned no money for investing into stock market urgently.
sentences.chinese: 他急急地炒股票，一點錢也沒賺得。

sentences.english: Fund is fried it is to get base civilian approbate, be winning is to be defeated, see lot.
sentences.chinese: 基金炒股是得到基民認可的，是贏是輸，就看運氣了。

sentences.english: Bridge mother fries a failure, beauty is lovelorn again, can sell repay a debt the house only.
sentences.chinese: 梁母炒股失敗，美麗又失戀，只能將房子賣掉還債。

definition: to invest in stock/to buy shares
trader or dealer (of stocks and shares etc)
to immobilize with a lasso/to be trapped in the stock market
